org.jpws.front.util

Class ButtonBarDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.jpws.front.util.ButtonBarDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AboutDialog, DatabaseDialog, EditorDialog, ExportCSVDialog, FileInfoDialog, FindTextDialog, FontChooser, HtmlBrowserDialog, ImportCSVDialog, MessageDialog, PasswordDialog, PolicyDialog, PortableInstallDialog, PreferencesDialog, UserOptionDialog

    public class ButtonBarDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    This is a dialog framework (extending JDialog) including a buttonbar component in the South, which can hold a variety of typically usable or custom made buttons.

    By default a ButtonBarDialog is not resizable and the Window-Closing event is equivalent to CANCEL (1. option) or OK (2. option) button pressed by the user. Default button execution is synchronous, which normally means on the EDT.

    Since:
    0-5-0
    Author:
    Wolfgang Keller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                       int type,
                       boolean modal)
                throws java.awt.HeadlessException
        Constructor for an empty dialog of given type and modality.
        Parameters:
        owner - Window the parent window (Dialog or Frame); may be null
        type - int, dialog type declares standard buttons used (values from class DialogButtonBar, use DialogButtonBar.BUTTONLESS for void button bar)
        modal - boolean, whether this dialog is modal
        Throws:
        java.awt.HeadlessException

        Overrides:

      • setClipping

        public void setClipping(boolean v)
        Sets whether this dialog's window is allowed to clip with the system screen, so that only part of it may be visible when initially displayed. By default true.
        Parameters:
        v - boolean true == clipping allowed
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • setAutonomous

        public void setAutonomous(boolean v)
        Sets whether this dialog is given the AUTONOMOUS feature (title). Dialogs which are NOT autonomous get disposed when programmatically set to INVISIBLE, while autonomous dialogs may return to VISIBLE state later e.g. through a return to VISIBLE of its parent window. By default this feature is false.
        Parameters:
        v - boolean true == dialog is autonomous
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • isClippingAllowed

        public boolean isClippingAllowed()
        Returns whether this dialog's window is allowed to clip with the system screen.
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • setCloseByEscape

        public void setCloseByEscape(boolean v)
        Sets whether this dialog can be closed by the ESCAPE button. If true, the triggered action of the ESCAPE button is equivalent to the WindowClosing event (as called by a frame decoration close, e.g.). The default value is true.
        Parameters:
        v - boolean true == closeable by ESCAPE
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • isCloseByEscape

        public boolean isCloseByEscape()
        Returns true if and only if this dialog can be closed by pressing the ESCAPE button.
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • setBarGap

        public void setBarGap(int v)
        Sets an (additional) display gap between button bar and dialog panel. (Defaults to zero.)
        Parameters:
        v - pixel of gap

      • setButtonBar

        public void setButtonBar(DialogButtonBar bar,
                         java.lang.String constraints)
        Sets a new button bar for this dialog. If a button bar existed previously, it is removed. If no orientation is specified by constraints, the user must make the button bar an element of the content pane before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        bar - DialogButtonBar the new button bar or null to remove existing bar
        constraints - String location of bar in display (use BorderLayout constraints) or null for no specified placement

      • moveRelatedTo

        public void moveRelatedTo(java.awt.Component parent)
        Makes this dialog move whenever the parent component is moved or resized. Use null to disengage.
        Parameters:
        parent - move-able Component, e.g. windows, frames, dialogs

      • moveTo

        public java.awt.Point moveTo(java.awt.Point p,
                             int speed)
        Moves this dialog to a new location on screen by showing a movement animation.
        Parameters:
        p - Point new location of this dialog in the coordinates of its owner
        speed - int movement speed in pixel per second
        Returns:
        Point location reached

      • storeBounds

        public void storeBounds(PersistentOptions options,
                        java.lang.String token,
                        boolean relative)
        Stores the current window bounds to a PersistentOptions object. Position of the window may be interpreted as absolute or relative to its parent window.
        Parameters:
        options - PersistentOptions persistent storage place
        token - name of bounds record in options
        relative - if true bounds are seen in relation to parent window otherwise absolute

      • gainBounds

        public boolean gainBounds(PersistentOptions options,
                          java.lang.String token,
                          boolean relative)
        Sets the bounds of this window from a stored bounds record in a PersistentOptions object. Does nothing if the specified bounds could not be found.
        Parameters:
        options - PersistentOptions persistent storage place
        token - name of bounds record in options
        relative - if true bounds are seen in relation to parent window otherwise absolute
        Returns:
        true if and only if the bounds were set

      • gainLocation

        public void gainLocation(PersistentOptions options,
                         java.lang.String token,
                         boolean relative)
        Sets the location of this window from a stored bounds record in a PersistentOptions object. Does nothing if bound info is not found.
        Parameters:
        options - PersistentOptions persistent storage place
        token - name of bounds record in options
        relative - if true bounds are seen in relation to parent window otherwise absolute

      • isOkPressed

        public boolean isOkPressed()
        Whether this dialog was terminated by a (validated) user pressed OK or CLOSE button.
        Returns:
        true if and only if "OK" or "CLOSE" was pressed and termination of the dialog was validated

      • isNoPressed

        public boolean isNoPressed()
        Whether this dialog was terminated by a user pressed NO button. (This value can only return true if the dialog was initiated to contain the "NO" button by a corresponding dialog type parameter.)
        Returns:
        true if and only if "No" was pressed

      • isCancelPressed

        public boolean isCancelPressed()
        Whether this dialog was terminated by a user pressed CANCEL button.
        Returns:
        true if and only if "CANCEL" was pressed

      • isUnselected

        public boolean isUnselected()
        Whether there was no user option pressed, leading to termination of the dialog. This may be interesting when a dialog has been closed other than by user handling.
        Returns:
        true if and only if neither Ok/Close nor Cancel has been pressed at the time when this method is invoked

      • setSynchronous

        public void setSynchronous(boolean v)
        Sets whether actions triggered on the systemic button bar will run on the Event Dispatching Thread (EDT) (v == true) or on a separate threads (v == false). By default this value is true.
        Parameters:
        v - boolean

      • setCorrectedBounds

        public void setCorrectedBounds(java.awt.Rectangle r)

      • setCorrectedLocation

        public void setCorrectedLocation(java.awt.Point p)

      • markSingleton

        public boolean markSingleton(java.lang.String name)
        Tests if there is another dialog active (global) with the parameter name. If negative, the given name is registered as active singleton dialog (global).
        Parameters:
        name - (singleton) dialog name
        Returns:
        true if and only if the given name has been registered as singleton dialog with this operation; false means there is another dialog already active with this name
